revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix
revision.text:
{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = <!-- Image filename --> |image1_size = <!-- Image size, ex.150px --> |caption = Intel Edison Arduino Expansion |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = <!-- product page url only --> |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = <!-- wikidevi.wi-cat.ru page, included underscores --> |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none --> |ddwrtsupport = <!-- Activation, Donation, Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, TBD, Unofficially, WIP --> |openwrtsupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |tomatosupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |gargoylesupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, -->
|brand = Intel |model = Edison |submodelappend = yes |submodel = Arduino Expansion |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = N150 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = development board |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = 2AB8ZND1 |icid = 1000X-ND1 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Intel Atom;; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = x86-64 |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- x86-64 Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 500 |cpu2chip1 = Intel Quark;; |cpu2_cores = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |cpu2_type = x86-64 |x86-64rev2 = <!-- x86-64 Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu2spd = 100 |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = SK hynix;H26M31003GMR; |flash1size = 4 GiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes --> |flash2type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla2_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla2chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash2size = <!-- Size of flash --> |flash2maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes --> |flash3maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 1 GiB |ram1chip = Samsung;K3QF1F10DM-BGCF; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |ram2type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram2type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram2spd = <!-- 3400,3333,3300,3200,3100,3000,2800,2666,2600,2400,2133,2000,1866,1600,1066,1333,800 --> |ram2size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram2chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram2_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_none = true |oui = FC:C2:DE
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;2014.04;; |stockos = Linux;3.10.17;Poky 1.6;
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0, Micro SD Card slot |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCIexpress Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_usb_num = 2 |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = 1 |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 7-15 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.5 |pwr_barrel_len = 9.5 |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, USB Female Micro-B,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = Micro SD Card slot, Bluetooth 4.0, Arduino expansion, I2C, UART, I2S, SPI, GPIO |addchip = PMIC;TI;SNB9024;;1;,,, USB to Serial UART Chip;FTDI;FT232R;;1;,,, USB 2.0 OTG Transceiver;TI;TUSB1211;;1;,,, High-Speed USB 2.0 1:2 Multiplexer/Demultiplexer;TI;TS3USB221;;1;,,, 16bit I2C-bus I/O Port w/Interrupt;NXP;PCAL9535A;;2;,,, 16bit I2C-bus GPIO w/Interrupt;NXP;PCAL9555;;1;,,, USB Power Manager w/OVP and Li-Ion Charger;Linear Technology;LTC4067;;1;,,, 8-Channel 1 MSPS 12-Bit Serial ADC;TI;ADS7951;;1;,,, 3-17V 3A Step-Down Converter;TI;TPS62133;;1;,,, DC/DC Converter IC;Texas Instruments;TPS62130;;1;,,, Integrated Load Switch;ON Semiconductor;FDC6331L;;5;,,, SIngle-Bit Dual-Supply Bus Transceiver;TI;SN74LVC1T45;;20;,,, 2-Channel Analog Multiplexer/Demultiplexer;NXP;74LVC2G53;;12;,,, MMC, SD Card, MemoryStick Voltage-Translation w/ESD Protection;TI;TXS0206-29;;1;,,, 0.2-2.5A Programmable High-Side Current Limit Power Switch;Microchip;MIC2039;;1;,,, |802dot11_protocols = abgn
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = <!-- Leave blank --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = EoL |eoldate = 06/19/2017 |fccapprovdate = 08/25/2014 |estreldate = 09/2014 |estprice = 107 |upc = 735858291330 |ean = 5032037070010 |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Murata SS4703063 |rad1modif = <!-- Radio Module Interface Type, Leave blank for none --> |rad1chip1 = Cypress;CYW43340; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |rad1n = 150/150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Intel Atom]]'' Dual-Core @500MHz :[[Intel]] ''Quark'' Microcontroller @100MHz *Memory: 1GB RAM (LPDDR3 POP) *Storage: 4GB Flash (eMMC v4.51) *Wi-Fi: [[Cypress]] CYW43340 (802.11abgn) *USB: 1x USB 2.0 Host, 1x micro USB 2.0 OTG *Power Source: 7-15V/1A via barrel :or 5V/2A via micro USB :or lithium-ion battery
==Links of Interest== :[https://www.intel.com/content/dam/support/us/en/documents/edison/sb/edison_pb_331179002.pdf Product Brief] [https://www.intel.com/content/dam/support/us/en/documents/edison/sb/edison-arduino-hardware-guide.pdf Hardware Guide]
*[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel_Edison ''Intel Edison'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2014/09/10/50-intel-edison-board-for-wearables-features-an-soc-with-a-dual-core-atom-processor-and-a-quark-mcu/ ''$50 Intel Edison Board'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[https://linuxgizmos.com/edison-iot-module-ships-with-atom-plus-quark-combo-soc/ ''Edison IoT module ships with Atom/Quark combo SoC'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
